content: you get to a place where two previous hexagons are joined slip_stitch join through the space between the two hexagons meeting corner the hook is pointing at this hole in the picture crochet the rest of the way around each hexagon in this column joining then needed except on the last hexagon if the next column of hexagons ends higher only join 1 side and edge 1 more side as in the picture if the next column of hexagons ends lower join 1 side and edge 2 more sides join the next column of hexagons on where they meet up with the previous column repeat what you did for the second column for as many more columns as you have except the last one on the last column crochet around the remaining sides of the hexagons in this column and then continue around the outside to finish where you started to add a round of edging continue to work in pattern and when you come to a valley do a double_crochet into the space between the corners instead of whatever your pattern calls for depending on your gauge or preferences you can do a single_crochet or half_double_crochet instead to change how these valley corners look bigger layout rh bigger layout lh
